data_maturity_score.evidence: Job posting only mentions Tableau, SQL, Oracle, Hive with no reference to pipelines, orchestration, CI/CD, data quality or governance tools.

data_maturity_level.evidence: Score of 1 maps to ad_hoc maturity level.

maturity_signals.evidence: No modern data stack components, no CI/CD, no data quality testing, no catalog or lineage mentioned.

scope_creep_score.evidence: Responsibilities are limited to feature development, debugging, and Tableau dashboard creation; no mention of data science, dev‑ops, or product ownership.

overtime_risk_score.evidence: No explicit overtime or on‑call language, but consulting roles at large firms can involve client‑driven peaks.

role_clarity.evidence: Job description focuses specifically on Data Engineer‑Business Intelligence tasks.

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Low scope creep, moderate overtime risk, clear role but missing reporting and growth details.

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: Posting does not specify to whom the role reports.

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No manager title or hierarchy is described.

team_growth_velocity.evidence: No information about hiring pace or team expansion.

team_composition.evidence: No details on team size, DE count, or seniority mix.

reporting_structure.evidence: No reporting line is provided in the description.

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Description does not mention working embedded in product or cross‑functional squads.

work_life_balance_score.evidence: No PTO, remote, or on‑call policies are mentioned; typical consulting roles have variable hours.

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: No learning budget, mentorship, or career ladder is referenced.

tech_culture_score.evidence: Tech stack limited to Tableau, SQL, Oracle, Hive; no mention of modern engineering practices.

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No signals for open‑source, conference speaking, or innovation programs.

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: Job posting does not list code review, CI/CD, testing, or monitoring practices.

innovation_signals.evidence: No mention of experimentation, hackathons, or R&D time.

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No language about refactoring, tech‑debt reduction, or modernization.

ai_integration_level.evidence: No AI/ML tools, pipelines, or model serving are referenced.

hiring_urgency.evidence: No start‑date or urgency language appears.

competition_level.evidence: No data on applicant volume or market competitiveness.

company_stage_inferred.evidence: IBM is a global, publicly‑traded technology enterprise with established consulting divisions.

hiring_velocity.evidence: No indication of aggressive or steady hiring cadence.

team_size_signals.evidence: Job posting does not disclose size of the data engineering team.

funding_stage_signals.evidence: IBM is a publicly‑listed company; funding stage terminology is not applicable.

role_creation_type.evidence: No statement about whether the role is a new headcount or backfill.

strength_details: Role centers on BI data engineering with Tableau, SQL, Oracle and Hive.
Position is with IBM, a globally recognized enterprise offering extensive resources.
Responsibilities are clearly defined around feature development and debugging.
concern_details: Compensation range and benefits are not disclosed in the posting.
Reporting line and team structure are not specified.
No mention of career progression, mentorship, or learning budget.
best_fit_details: Engineers with 2‑4 years of experience in SQL, Tableau, and data‑warehouse technologies.
Candidates comfortable working in a large consulting environment and delivering client‑focused BI solutions.
Professionals seeking a focused data‑engineering role without heavy ML or dev‑ops responsibilities.
probe_details: Ask for the expected salary band, bonus structure, and any equity or benefits.
Clarify who the role reports to and how the data engineering team is organized.
Inquire about promotion pathways, mentorship programs, and learning budgets.
Request information on the size of the data engineering team and seniority mix.
Understand typical work hours, on‑call duties, and expectations for overtime.
leverage_details: Your extensive Tableau and SQL experience directly aligns with the core technical requirements.
Experience with Oracle and Hive matches the data‑warehouse stack the team uses.
summary.overall_assessment: The position offers a clear, focused BI data‑engineering role at a reputable enterprise (IBM). While compensation details are missing and reporting lines are vague, the job aligns well with candidates experienced in SQL and Tableau who want stability and a well‑defined scope. Consider the limited growth signals before proceeding.
